Divya Bharti was an Indian film actress and model, who starred in a number of commercially Telugu pictures and then migrated to Hindi cinema. Her rise to stardom was so spontaneous that, even leading ladies like Vijaya Shanthi had to compete with her in Telugu cinema. Known for her bright look and spontaneity, she was ultimate teen-age throb down south. Due to her huge popularity in Telugu cinema, many Bollywood directors made a bee-line at her doors to sign her in Hindi cinema opposite Rishi Kapoor, Suuny Deol, Shah Rukh Khan and Govinda.

She acted opposite Chiranjeevi and Mohan Babu in Telugu and became the most popular actress due to box-office ratings. She was so popular in Telugu film industry that even a temple was built in her name.

Divya was also considered to be one of the most beautiful actresses. After her sudden demise, many of her roles went to Juhi Chawla, Kajol and even Madhuri Dixit. It is believed that she was supposed to get the leading lady role in Dilwale Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge or even Darr opposite Sharukh Khan. Later on, same roles went to Kajol and Juhi Chawla respectively.

As she moved to Bollywood from Telugu cinema, she made it a point that she will never quit Telugu film industry and work atleast in one film per year. Her role in Bobbili Raja opposite Daggubati Venkatesh, which was released in 1990 is still as one of the most popular Telugu movie even now. Her last film in Telugu was Chittamma Mogudu, that got released in 1992 with Mohan Babu and her last film in Hindi language was Kshatriya in 1993 opposite Sunny Deol, opposite who she made her debut in Bollywood Vishwatma, directed by Rajiv Rai in 1992.

Divya was born in Mumbai to Omprakash Bharti and Meeta Bharti on February 26, 1974. She was a drop out from school but went to become a top star. She was compared with Sridevi in 1990 and became the greatest star at the time. Later on she became a Bollywood’s big star too. Her death still remains a mystery.

Regarded as the wife of the first superstar of Hindi cinema Rajesh Khanna, she made her foray into films with showman Raj Kapoor’s Bobby in 1973. She later spent her life as a devoted house wife after marrying Rajesh Khanna in the same year 1973 and had almost had quit the film industry. She played her first Bollywood teen role in Bobby and became heart-throb of Indians. She is highly popular for the title role of Bobby she was cast opposite Raj Kapoor’s son Rishi Kapoor which was a blockbuster hit which went to capture the heart of cinegoers for teen romance, melodious music and versatile performances. Her ultimate decision to quit cinema in 1973, put a big question mark to the seasoned actress. She bid bye to the film industry and made a comeback with Ramesh Sippys’ Sagar, which won her critical acclaim.

Dimple Kapadia has managed to find a place in the history of Indian cinema with some of her soul-stirring performances after she made her comeback with Ramesh Sippy’s Sagar that featured again Rishi Kapoor and Kamal Haasan. Winner of Filmfare Awards for Best Actress in Bobby and Sagar, she bagged some serious roles in art cinema too. Along with Sridevi and Rekha, she went to become one of three leading actresses in India in 1980s. She then managed to find a place in the history of Indian cinema with some of her soul-stirring performances in Kalpana Lazmi’s Rudali for which she got national award. Govind Nihalin’s Drishti and Gulzar’s Lekin will be remembered for her soulful performances. Even in Mahesh Bhatt’s Kaash, her role was critically acclaimed.

After winning national best actress award and Filmfare award for Lazmi’s Rudali, She also acted in a Bengali movie directed by Mrinal Sen. She was regarded as the most glamorous, spontaneous, instinctive, intelligent and hard-working actress in 1990. She also acted in Subash Ghai’s film Ram Lakhan opposite Jackie Shroff. She acted with almost all leading actors of Indian cinema such as Amitabh Bachchan, Kamal Haasan, Feroz Khan, Raj Babbar, Nana Patekar, Vinod Khanna and Rishi Kapoor and so on.

She has two daughters, Twinkle Khanna, who is married to today’s action hero Akshay Kumar and Rinke Khanna. She has acted in Bengali, Malayalam and Tamil films too. She was last seen in Welcome Back and got people’s recognition in Cocktail released in 2012. She will be always remembered as Bobby girl of Indian cinema.

Born in the year 1970, Pooja Bedi is a former Hindi actress. Actor Kabir Bedi is her father. She studied at Besant Montessori, located in Mumbai. She excelled not only in studies but also in extracurricular activities including swimming, basketball etc.

Bedi was wedded to Guetta Ebrahim Furniturewalla but eventually they parted ways. They are blessed with two children. Her career in Bollywood was during the years 1991 to 1994. She also worked in many campaigns and commercials. She is famous for the Kamasutra campaign. This was done for a good cause i.e. to instill awareness of AIDS. Pooja Bedi also had a brief stint as an anchor of talk show.

Bedi worked in plays, including Wow What a Girl, Carry on Papa and A Bengali Jatra. Vish Kanya was her first film and she is best remembered for her role in Aamir Khan starrer Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikander. She also worked in Lootere and Aatank Hi Aatank.

Bedi also worked as a columnist for The Hindustan Times, The Times of India and Mid Day. She had penned articles for several publications. Her talk show Just Pooja aired in Zoom TV won several awards and it was telecasted for around 100 episodes. She got herself involved in Jhalak Dhiklaja, a dance show wherein she cultivated a passion for ballroom dance. She had hosted many shows. She also had a brief stint with Big Boss 5.

Her philanthropic side was at its best when she supported breast cancer awareness, welfare of street children, etc. Bedi never fails to voice her thoughts and this she does through newspapers and electronic media. She worked on the memoirs of her mother during the year 2000. She didn’t hesitate to do breathtaking stunts in one of the shows that she participated. Travelling and reading are some of her interests.

Kavita Krishnamurthy is the female playback singer, who has sung maximum good songs with Kumar Sanu. She is a most versatile singer, who has amazing classical voice and perfectly trained. She is one among the few singers, who has versitality in singing.

She was a gifted singer, who had won medals since her school days and she got trained by her aunt in Rabindra Sangeet too. It was her aunt, who met Hemant Kumar, the music composer and singer, and wanted Hemant Kumar to give Kavita a chance to record a song.

It was then at age of nine, she got an opportunity to record a song with Lata Mangeshkar in Bengali. It was after a gap of many years, when Kavita was in St. Xaviers College in Mumbai for annual day function, Hemant Kumar’s daughter Ranu Mukherjee spotted her and she took her initiative to introduce again the singer Kavita to Hemant Kumar. Hemant was impressed by her grounding in music and gave her a break in live performances. Even noted playback singer Manna Dey acknowledged her versatility as a singer and employed her to sing jingles.

Later on, Hema Malini’s mother Jaya Chakrabarty introduced this singer to the music director Laxmikant Pyarelal and the rest is a history. Her first Hindi film that became popular was for Pyaar Jhukta Nahin composed by Laxmikant Pyarelal, after which offers came pouring and she sang song for 1942-A Love story, Mr India, which made her very popular.

Her number “Hawa Hawaii” in Mr India, is still popular with masses, but before getting a chance in Bollywood, she had also sung for Kannada films too. Kavitha established herself as a leading playback singer in 1990s and had worked with composers like A R Rahman, Annu Malik, Jatin Shah and others.

She married violinist L. Subramaniam. She also did popular devotional and ghazal albums too. For her contribution to Indian film music, she received Padmashri award from Indian government.

Alka Yagnik is a very popular playback singer of the Bollywood film industry. She was born on March 20, 1966. She has been working in the Hindi film industry for three decades. She had bagged seven Filmfare awards out of the thirty five nominations at the Filmfare awards. It was for the best playback singer award category. Her singing is quite beautiful and she was felicitated by many icons.

She came to the Bollywood industry as a singer at her early age. This gave her a lot of experience and she groomed herself as a consistent and successful singer. Alka Yagnik's songs were listed more than 20 times in the “BBC's “Top 40 Bollywood Soundtracks of all time”. Alka Yagnik was born in Kolkata on 20 March, 1966 to the Gujarati-Hindu parents. She started her singing career at the age of six while she had sung the song for the All India Radio, Kolkata.

She came to Mumbai at the age of 10 as a child singer. She had sung 2482 songs in 1114 films as of date. Alka Yagnik has a soothing voice that manifests the song even better. She is the fifth most successful and prominent singer of Bollywood cinema. Her career in Bollywood has been more than three decades and she had pulled out pretty good in the duet numbers. She is a classically trained singer who had profound knowledge in it. Alka Yagnik had won a lot of awards in the prominent ones like Zee Cine Awards, Star screen awards, Filmfare, IIFA awards, Bollywood movie awards, etc. Alka Yagnik had been highly rewarded for having won a lot of Filmfare awards and got the maximum number of nominations.

In the hundred years of Hindi cinema function, Alka Yagnik's song “Taal Se Taal Mila” from the movie Taal was voted as the best song of the century. This had been done by Fever 104, , Hindustan Times and DesiMartini. She has been active in the Cinema industry since 1980.

Born on 20th November, 1969, Shilpa Shirodkar was one of the most popular actresses in the 90s. She was born in Bombay. She came into the limelight after been adjudged the winner of the Miss India title in the year 1992. She has a sister named Namratha Shirodkar. Namratha Shirodkar is married to southern film superstar Mahesh Babu. Both of them started their Bollywood career at the same time. Her sister too was adjudged the winner of the Miss India title in the year 1993.

Shilpa Shirodkar comes from a Marathi family background. Her grandmother Meenakshi Shirodkar was a famous Marathi actress. She started her Bollywood career with the 1989 movie “Bhrashtachar”. She played the part of a blind girl in the movie. Her next movie was “Kishen Kanhaiya” featuring Anil Kapoor as the lead actor. She, then, showed in a number of Bollywood movies like Pehchan, Trinetra, Dil Hi To Hai and the most famous among them being “Khuda Gawah”. She was one of the nominees for best actress in a supporting role category for the same movie. She was widely acclaimed for her roles in movies like Gopi Kishan, Mrityudand, etc.

Recently, Shilpa Shirodkar has turned her way into the television industry. She was seen playing the role of Kamla Bai in the serial “Ek Mutthi Aasmaan”. Shilpa Shirodkar tied the knot with Apresh Ranjit. He hails from the UK. She then decided to quit her acting career and settled with her husband in the UK. She has a daughter named Anushka.

Nana Patekar is a popular Indian actor who was born in 1st January in 1951. He is also a successful filmmaker and writer simultaneously. He was born in the place named Murud-Janjira which is located in Raigad district in Maharashtra. His parents are Dinkar Patekar and Sanjana Patekar. Nana Patekar studied Applied Arts at the Sir J.J Institute in Mumbai. From his college life, he was attracted to acting and he did attend the inter-college dramatics. He also loved to sketch. His journey in the film industry started in 1974 with the film named ‘Garman’. After that, he acted on several movies like “Mohre(1987)”, “Salaam Bombay(1988)” and so on. But, he came to the gossip headline by his acting in the film “Parinda” which was released in 1989. He appeared as a villain in that movie. As the recognition of the fabulous acting in that movie he won the National Film Award as well as the Filmfare Award as best Supporting Actor. He acted as villain in some movies, but most of the cases, he acted in positive roles. Most glamorous movies acted by him are – “Khamoshi (acted as a deaf father)”, “Krantiveer (acted as a gambling son)”,“Ab Tak Chhappan (acted as a police officer)”, “Paathshaala”, “Rajneeti (acted as a political leader)”,“Wajood (acted as a schizophrenic)”, “Welcome (acted as a powerful,but funny don)”, “It’s My Life” and so on. His natural acting is always entertaining to the people. As a successful filmmaker, he is the creator of the famous film “Prahar: The Final Attack” in which the glamour queen Madhuri Dixit was the leading heroine. He is also a little bit involved in playback music. His upcoming movies are “Saamna”, “Welcome Back” and “Yahan Ke Hum Sikandar”.

Kader Khan was born on 12 November, 1937 in Kabul, Afghanistan. His father named Abdil Rehman is from Afghanistan while his mother named Iqbal Begum is from India. Kader Khan is an actor and writer. Kader Khan obtained a Master's Diploma in Civil Engineering from the Institution of Engineers in India. After completing his education, he started working as professor of Civil engineering in M. H. Saboo Siddik College of Engineering in Byculla.

Khan wrote and acted a play on College’s Annual day function. Dilip Kumar was very impressed after watching his acting and Kumar singed him for his two upcoming films: Sagina Mahato and Bairaag. Kader Khan acted in almost 300 films in Indian Film Industry. Also, he wrote the dialogues for over 250 Indian films from 1970s to 1990s. He made his debut as an actor in the film “Daag” (1973). He got one lakh twenty-one thousand rupees from Producer Manmohan Desai for writing the dialogues for the film Roti (1974). He has played different roles in films as father, uncle, comedian, villain.

He worked with many actors. Govinda and Kader Khan have worked together in 41 movies. Govinda is known for best comedy actor in the main role. Their most popular movies are Joru Ka Ghulam, Naseeb, Bade Miyan Chote Miyan, Deewana Mastana Haseena Maan Jaayegi and Anari No.1. Also, he worked with many comedians like Shakti Kapoor and Jhony lever. He was awarded the Sahitya Shiromani Award, for his work in Indian cinema by Indian Government in 2013. Also, he got the Filmfare award for Best Comedian for Baap Numbri Beta Dus Numbari (1993).

Further, he won two Filmfare awards for Best Dialogue for his film Meri Awaaz Suno (1982) and Angaar (1993). Also, he won the Best Actor supporting role Male for his acting in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi (2004) and was nominated for Best Comedian actor for Filmfare award 9 times for 1984s to 1999s cinemas.

Dev Anand would be nostalgically remembered by filmgoers of the golden era of Bollywood that saw the transition from the black and white age to the age of colour. He happened to be one out of the famous quartet of heroes of that golden age, along with Dilip Kumar, Raj Kapoor and the evergreen Ashok Kumar. More than his core acting abilities, Dev Anand was remembered more for his sheer handsomeness and an unbroken style of delivering dialogues with subtle and sudden modulations, and a fascination for nodding while delivering. Yet he had hit films to his credit, one after the other, in the 100 plus films that he had acted in, most of which had him as the central male protagonist.

Like most of his famous contemporaries, Dev Anand also came from Punjab, and having completed his graduation in English Literature, he moved over to Mumbai for a job in the early 1940s. This seems to have been a happy coincidence for him, as his older brother Chetan, who was already in Mumbai and an active member of the Indian People's Theater Association (IPTA), encouraged Dev into the performing arts. Dev himself was also inspired by seeing films and nursed a desire to emulate famous actors of his time like Ashok Kumar. His own break came in the 1946 movie “Hum Ek Hain” produced by Prabhat films, whose production team was won over by his handsome looks and were confident of his making the grade in a film career. As luck would have it, during the making of the film he struck up a friendship with the famous Guru Dutt who also went on to become one of the renowned producer director and actors of the period.

This association resulted in so many hit films over the next 10 years, starting with the 1951 film, “Baazi”, which incidentally was the very second film of Dev’s own production House Nav Ketan. This film was directed by Guru Dutt, and its tremendous success propelled Dev onto the front lines of Hindi cinema. This was followed in 1952 by “Jaal”, which like Baazi was another big musical hit. Even though Guru Dutt himself got busy as an actor, the Dev Anand – Guru Dutt co-operation continued through director Raj Khosla, who was Guru Dutt’s chief assistant and whom he seems to have specially earmarked for Dev’s films, like “CID” (1956) and “Kala Paani” in 1958.

Like Dev’s association with Guru Dutt, his working together with the singing star Surayya in late 1940s also raised a lot of ripples, for its perceived romantic overtones, the duo having worked in seven films, one after the other between 1948 and 1951, including hits like “Afsar” (1950) and ending with “Do Sitare” . Likewise, Ashok Kumar too had a hand in boosting the career of Dev, after the latter had become typified as an actresses’ hero in the 40s. It was in “Ziddi”(1948) that Ashok Kumar, with his Bombay Talkies’ connections, selected Dev to be the hero, and it worked wonderfully well with the film becoming a overnight hit. This film also marked the beginning of Kishore Kumar becoming the singing voice of Dev Anand, an association that lasted till the legendary singer’s death.

To recount the life of a legend like Dev Anand, is not easy, and one can hardly do justice to his entire career, studded as it was with so many hits. The films from a more serious genre that would obviously remain in people’s minds would be “Guide” in 1968 based on R.K. Narayan’s famous novel; and the earlier “Hum Dono” in 1961, and “Kala Pani” in both of which he has given sensitive portrayals. On the lighter and romantic side were “CID” in 1956 and “Jewel Thief” in 1968 both being crime thrillers and “Hare Rama Hare Krishna” in 1971 which saw Dev in his directorial debut.

During a long career, as long as his, it was natural to have to his name a string of awards and honours, but more than any of these would be his inimitable style that would remain in the minds and hearts of his fans for years to come.

For Danny Denzongpa the voyage to the glittering world of films from distant Gangtok in Sikkim, where he was born and had his preliminary education, was quite eventful. In fact his entry into a film career was in many ways a matter of unexpected coincidence. Finishing college from Darjeeling, West Bengal, he made it to the prestigious Armed Forces Medical College in Pune, for he had always dreamed, like many from his region, to join the Indian Army. This desire was perhaps fuelled by his bagging the Best Cadet Award from West Bengal, and in being selected for the annual Republic Day parade in New Delhi. However, once in Pune, he switched over to the Film Institute instead of the Armed Forces College. That is when Tshering Phintso Denzongpa of Gangtok became the future “Danny” Denzongpa of the Mumbai film world. He had decided to change his name to a simpler sounding "Danny" as he realized that his original name would have been difficult to be pronounced once he entered films.

Danny’s film career due to its sheer length of 44 years and 200 plus films cannot be accommodated in a brief profile of his, but the high points of his career and sheer variety of his roles can be discussed, as well as the vicissitudes of his career. Although he had to manage with B-grade movies on his entry in 1971, just 2 years into his career, he drew attention for the role of crippled husband, emoting his frustrations, in “Dhundh” During the entire 70s he displayed his versatility, making a clear mark for himself in the industry. In fact, he portrayed as much of positive roles as he did villainous ones, narrowly missing the role of Gabbar Singh in “Sholay” due to a mix up of shooting dates. In 1978 a major landmark came in his career for his role in “Devata” (1978) which saw him get substantial roles after that including big budget ones. However, in the beginning of the 1980s he suddenly lost interest in films, being type cast in villainous roles with the same setting over and over again.

This spell was broken briefly when he directed the Rajesh Khanna starrer “Phir Wohi Raat” for N.N. Sippy in 1980, but although he went on getting any number of roles he wanted, most of them were not to his liking, as they seemed to be carbon copies of similar roles he had done previously. In between, however, there was something more satisfying for him when he made an international appearance in “Seven Years in Tibet”, co-starring with the redoubtable Brad Pitt. Danny, however, reduced his appearances at the turn of the century and between 2003 and 2009 starred in only 10 movies, with very few appearances thereafter. Any profile of Danny would be incomplete without the mention that he was not only an accomplished singer for Nepali songs, but has sung alongside Lata, Asha and Mohd Rafi in Hindi films too.

Shah Rukh Khan or also known as SRK is a prominent Indian film actor, television personality and producer. He was born on November 2, 1965 in New Delhi, India. He is often called as the ‘Baadshah of Bollywood’, ‘King Khan’ and ‘King of Bollywood’. The actor has done more than 80 films in Bollywood. He was cited as ‘The World’s Biggest Movie Star’ by the Los Angeles Times. Khan is also one of the wealthiest actors in the world, with over $400–600 million net worth. He also won several accolades including the 14 Filmfare Awards.

Khan went to St. Columba’s School in Delhi where he topped in studies and sports like football and hockey, where he got the Sword of Honour Award, a school’s highest award. He acted in several stage plays and gained praises for mimicking Bollywood actors like Amitabh Bachchan and Mumtaz. He studied at Hansraj College from 1985 to 1988 to get a degree in Economics but the actor spent much of his time in attending the Theatre Action Group (TAG) in Delhi. He studies acting through his mentor, Director Barry John. Later, Khan studied at Jamia Millia Islamia and took up a degree in Mass Communications, but he left it to enter the showbiz industry. He attended Delhi’s National School of Drama on his early years in Bollywood.

He started his career during the late 80’s with some appearances in many television series. He was debuted in Bollywood in the blockbuster hit film, Deewana in 1992. He was also recognized for doing villain roles in movies like Darr, Baazigar and Anjaam. He rose to fame after he was starred in various romantic films like Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge, Dil To Pagal Hai, Kuch Kuch Hota Hai and Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham. In year 2002, Khan gained critical acclaimed for his role as an alcoholic in the romantic drama film, Devdas; as a scientist of NASA in Swades; a coach in Chak De! India and My Name is Khan in 2010 where he played the role of a man with Asperger Disorder. For his outstanding contributions to the film industry, he received the Padma Shri Award by the Government of India and the Legion d’honneur and Ordre des Arts et des Lettres by the Government of France.

This year, he became the co-chairman of Red Chillies Entertainment and all its subsidiaries. Khan became one of the owners of the cricket team, Kolkata Knight Riders of the Indian Premier League. He is also a regular host and stage show performer. The media called him as Brand SRK due to his many endorsements and business ventures. He is also a philanthropy who has given health care and reliefs to the disaster victims. He gained the UNESCO’s Pyramide con Marni Award in year 2011 for supporting the education of many children.

Khan got married to Gauri Chibber on October 25, 1991 and they have been blessed with a son named Aryan and a daughter named Suhana. In year 2013, through a surrogate mother, the couple had another baby named Abram.

Anil Kapoor was born on 24th December 1956 in Mumbai, Maharashtra. He is a very popular Bollywood actor cum producer. He is active in the films right from the year 1979 until the present. He got married with Sunita Kapoor in the year 1984. He has three children, namely Sonam Kapoor, who is a Bollywood actress, Rhea Kapoor, who is a Bollywood producer and Harshvarshan Kapoor. Anil Kapoor is the son of Surinder Kapoor and Nirmal.

His father was a very prominent Indian film producer. Anil Kapoor had a profession as a Bollywood actor for about twenty five successful years. As right now, he is quite busy working in the international movies. He is best known for producing the film Gandhi, My Father. Hamare Tumhare is his first movie, which got released in the year 1979 and he had done a supporting character. He gained his name as an actor with the movie Vamsa Vruksham (1970), a Telugu movie.

After that part of time, he got a big opportunity to work with a legendary director of Indian Cinema who took the level of Indian film industry to International level and even beyond imagination. Maniratnam is such an icon and every actor has a lifetime dream of working in a single movie with him. But Anil Kapoor is so deserving and fortunate to get an occasion to work with this huge legend. The name of the movie is Pallavi Anu Pallavi which is a Kannada movie and this is the debut movie in Kannada for the actor.

He acted in multiple film industries in many movies and at the mean time he won many Filmfare Awards subsequently. His debut International movie was such a global hit and it is a great breakthrough for him too. He won an Award for the National Award winning movie namely, Slumdog Millionaire. He established himself as a singer as well and his recent release is a Hindi movie namely, Welcome Back that got released in 2015.

Aamir Khan or Mohammed Aamir Hussain Khan is Bollywood’s finest actor. He is a package for the Indian TV industry as he is a producer, director and actor an all-rounder kind of personality. Khan has an estimated net worth of $185 million. Aamir has born on 14th March, 1965 (aged 50) in Mumbai, Maharashtra. He did two marriages, first with Reena Dutta in 1986 they were together till 2002, than Kiran Rao came into his life, she is 42 years old, born in November, 1973, and they got married in 2005, now they both are living together happily in Mumbai. Kiran is from Bengaluru and also a director, screenwriter and producer.

Aamir’s father was Late Tahir Hussain, who was from a village Akhtiyarpur, Uttar Pradesh. He was also a screenwriter and director. Aamir is having 3 children today, one son Junaid and one daughter Ira from his first wife Reena Dutt and 1 son Azad Rao Khan from his second wife Kiran.

Aamir Khan is the fourth richest Bollywood personality in Hindi cinema. Aamir has earned his income by doing work as an actor, director and produced some movies and also worked in many advertisements. Khan began his career in a very tiny age with the film YAADON KI BAARAT released in 1973, which is produced by his uncle.

He started his professional career in 1984 with a movie HOLI. He won his first Film award as a Special jury after giving a fantastic performance in the movies like QAYAMAT SE QAYAMAT TAK released in 1988 and a movie RAAKH picturise in 1989. In 1996, Aamir received his first Filmfare Award as a Best Actor for his work in the movie RAJA HINDUSTANI. This movie was the blockbuster of his time.

He also won the Academy award and this time second Best actor award for the movie LAGAAN. Aamir won a Filmfare Critics Award also in 2006, as Best Actor in RANG DE BASANTI. He directed a movie also TAARE ZAMEEN PAR and won the Best director award after the nomination in Filmfare Award. Aamir is widely known as the perfectionist in the film industry.

Aamir Khan with his wife Kiran Rao in one of the awards function. He is a kind of actor who nominated for more than 20 types of awards like, IIFA Awards, National Film Awards, Apsara Award, Screen Award, Civilian Award and many more.

Amitabh Bachchan was born on October 11, 1942 in Allahabad, India. Bachchan's father was a prestigious Hindi poet Dr. Harivansh Rai Bachchan and his mother, Teji Bachchan, was a Sikh socialite. Being his parents’ first born, he has a junior male sibling resembling to his name Ajitabh. Bachchan went to Sherwood College before enlisting in Delhi University to complete his B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) degree. He became a cargo dealer in Calcutta after completing his graduation. Amitabh Bachchan married to Jaya Bhaduri and has one son named Abhishek and one daughter named Shweta. Bachchan's father passed on in 2003 and his mother in 2007.

In 1969, Bachchan made his film debut in Saat Hindustani a film administered by Khwaja Ahmad Abbas which won him the National Film Award for Best Newcomer. By the early 1970s, Bachchan had collected fame in crowds as the "Angry Young Man" in an arrangement of successful Hindi gimmick movies. His featuring part in Zanjeer was especially instrumental in propelling him to fame as an action-movie film legend. Amitabh didn’t stopped gaining fame and popularity and soon he delivered another successful movie Anand in 1971. Anand was followed by movies like Reshma Aur Shera and Parwana in the same year.

Being family friend with Rajiv Gandhi, he got an opportunity to choose to run for seat in the Congress from the place where he grew up. He challenged Allahabad's seat of eighth Lok Sabha against H. N. Bahuguna, previous Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh and won by one of the highest victory margins in history (68.2% of the vote). His political life, on the other hand, was fleeting in view of debates especially after Rajiv and he were embroiled in the now scandalous "Bofors" case alongside the U.K. based Hinduja Brothers.

In 1997, Bachchan endeavored to make his acting comeback with the film Mrityudata, produced by ABCL. However, the film was a disappointment both fiscally and basically. His vocation was spared with a successful film “Bade Miyan Chote Miyan (1998)”. In 2000, Bachchan facilitated the first season of “Kaun Banega Crorepati (KBC)”. Likewise in that year Amitabh Bachchan showed up in Yash Chopra's film industry hit “Mohabbatein” directed by Aditya Chopra. Different hits emulated, with Bachchan showing up as a more established family patriarch in Ek Rishtaa: The Bond of Love (2001), Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham (2001) and Baghban (2003). Bachchan is also well known for his profound, baritone voice. He has been a storyteller, a playback artist, and moderator for various projects.

Despite a couple of film industry disappointments in the 1990s and the 2000s ruined his career yet, Bachchan climbed his way back up to as a topnotch Bollywood actor, gaining Filmfare and International Film Awards for his work on movies like Baghban (2003), Khakee (2004) and Paa (2009). His hard work guaranteed his prosperity and now he is known as the "King of Bollywood".
